Dear Patrick

I hesitate to place an exact value on your tsuba; it is, ulti=
mately, 
worth what another collector is willing to pay for it.  That might=
, 
on e-Bay, be around =A3100-150.

Regards, John L.

> > Dear Patrick
> > 
> > Yes indeed - one of t=
he Namban group and probably made by a 
casting 
> > process in the early-m=
id C19.  This group is characterised by its 
> > openwork and undercutting;=
 the common presence of affronted 
dragons 
> > with the tama jewel; and th=
e atypically shaped seppa-dai.  All of 
> > these are present on your tsuba=
.
> > 
> > I would have expected a tsuba of this type to be of iron, but 
s=
ome 
> > were cast in bronze.  Interestingly these are unexpectedly 
attrac=
ted 
> > by a magnet, but the admixture of up to 30% of iron to bronze in 
=
> > order to reduce the cost of the expensive alloy was not unknown.  
> > =
Also, iron was a common inclusion in naturally occurring copper 
ore 
> > 
=
> > Regards, John L.
